update.description:
This is a follow-up to pull request #65. Besides switching to the ODE collision detector, it also adds features for attaching plane shapes, and introduces a unit test to verify that plane-mesh collisions are being detected.

I split this out into a separate PR from pull request #65 so that the other one can be treated as a hot fix to get meshes and planes all working properly while this PR can be reviewed more thoroughly.
update.title: Add PlaneShape features + test

content.raw: Sounds good. I went ahead and made the change in d8e522d.
content.html: Sounds good. I went ahead and made the change in d8e522d.

update.description:
This is a follow-up to pull request #65. Besides switching to the ODE collision detector, it also adds features for attaching plane shapes, and introduces a unit test to verify that plane-mesh collisions are being detected.

I split this out into a separate PR from pull request #65 so that the other one can be treated as a hot fix to get meshes and planes all working properly while this PR can be reviewed more thoroughly.
update.title: Add PlaneShape features + test

content.raw:
Honestly, I don’t remember what exactly I was thinking here. Maybe I thought that planes could only be pointed upwards or downwards, so this would have to be either a \+1 or -1. But that’s not a useful representation of a plane.

I agree with you that a plane in 2D should be thought of as a line with a normal vector where the normal vector indicates which half of the x/y plane is free space and which half is collision space. The API here will need to be changed.
content.html:
Honestly, I don’t remember what exactly I was thinking here. Maybe I thought that planes could only be pointed upwards or downwards, so this would have to be either a +1 or -1. But that’s not a useful representation of a plane.

I agree with you that a plane in 2D should be thought of as a line with a normal vector where the normal vector indicates which half of the x/y plane is free space and which half is collision space. The API here will need to be changed.

content.raw: I think we this can target ign-physics1. I'll go ahead and change it.
content.html: I think we this can target ign-physics1. I'll go ahead and change it.

content.raw: With the same interpretations as [my previous comment](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/66/add-planeshape-features-test/diff?w=1#comment-144725668), not all (x, y) locations will be on the plane.
content.html: With the same interpretations as my previous comment, not all (x, y) locations will be on the plane.

content.raw: I'm thinking of a plane in 3D as a line in 2D. With that interpretation, the normal vector would be a 2D vector, not a scalar. Can you clarify?
content.html: I'm thinking of a plane in 3D as a line in 2D. With that interpretation, the normal vector would be a 2D vector, not a scalar. Can you clarify?
